page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO STRACHAN
page.content: The{village of Strachan}is an old established Kirkton{at an ancient {crossing of the Feugh}on the Cairn o' Mount road from Banchory.A new bridge bye passes the centre. The{farmland around is mostly used for{grazing}with some{arable.}There is also land worked by the{Forrestry Commission.}There are several{public footpaths}in the area,Scolty{monument,}and 2 prehistoric{burial cairns.} There is a{caravan site}behind the hotel and several holiday caravans tucked away around the area. Most of this area is on the hillside looking out over the Mounth hills, dominated by the huge rocks on {Clochnaben.}Also on the hillside is a{water treatment works}west of the cairns. There is{no daily bus}service within the area.
